com.hcl.domino.mime

Interface MimeEntity


  • public interface MimeEntity
    Represents a MIME entity stored in a document, which may be standalone or part of a tree.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  MimeEntity.Encoding 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      MimeHeader addHeader(String headerName)
      Adds a header with the provied headerName and blank content.
      MimeHeader addHeader(String headerName, String value)
      Adds a header with the provied headerName and blank with the provided value.
      void appendChildEntity(MimeEntity entity)
      Append a child entity beneath this entity, with an auto-generated boundary.
      MimeEntity createChildEntity()
      Creates a child entity beneath this entity, with an auto-generated boundary.
      MimeEntity createChildEntity(MimeEntity sibling)
      Creates a child entity beneath this entity and placed immediately before the provided entity, with an auto-generated boundary.
      Optional<String> getBoundary()
      Retrieves the boundary value used to separate children within this multipart entity

      Returns a mutable Iterable view of the children of this multipart entity's children.

      Retrieves the content of this entity as a string.

      Retrieves and parses the Content-Type header of this entity, if present.

      Returns a list of all headers for this entity that match the provided headerName.

      Retrieves the parent of this entity, if it is part of a multipart tree.

    • Method Detail

      • getEncoding

        MimeEntity.Encoding getEncoding()
        Returns:
        the encoding used to store the MIME content

      • getInputStream

        default Optional<InputStream> getInputStream()
        Retrieves the content of the entity as an InputStream. If the entity's content is encoded, this decodes it.

        This is equivalent to calling getInputStream(true).

        Returns:
        an Optional describing a InputStream of the content of the entity, decoded from storage format, or an empty one if this is a multipart entity

      • getInputStream

        Optional<InputStream> getInputStream(boolean decode)
        Retrieves the content of the entity as an InputStream. If the entity's content is encoded, this decodes it if decode is true and leaves it encoded if it is false.

        This is equivalent to calling getInputStream(true).

        Parameters:
        decode - whether the content should be decoded from its storage format
        Returns:
        an Optional describing a InputStream of the content of the entity, optionally decoded from storage format, or an empty one if this is a multipart entity

      • getReader

        Optional<Reader> getReader()
        Retrieves a Reader for the text content of this entity. If the entity is encoded, this decodes it. Additionally, this reader will obey any charset parameter in the entity's Content-Type header, if present.
        Returns:
        an Optional describing a Reader for the content of this entity as text, or an empty one if this is a multipart entity

      • getContentAsString

        Optional<String> getContentAsString()
        Retrieves the content of this entity as a string. If the entity's content is encoded, this decodes it.
        Returns:
        an Optional describing the content of the entity as a String, or an empty one if this is a multipart entity

      • setContent

        void setContent(InputStream is,
                MimeEntity.Encoding encoding)
        Sets the content of the MIME entity from the provided InputStream, applying the requested storage encoding.

        Note: the content of the stream should not be already encoded.

        Parameters:
        is - an InputStream to read; cannot be null
        encoding - the MimeEntity.Encoding value to use
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this is a multipart entity

      • getContentType

        default Optional<jakarta.mail.internet.ContentType> getContentType()
                                                            throws jakarta.mail.internet.ParseException
        Retrieves and parses the Content-Type header of this entity, if present.
        Returns:
        an Optional describing the ContentType object, or an empty one if no header is set
        Throws:
        jakarta.mail.internet.ParseException - if the Content-Type header is present and invalid

      • getParent

        Optional<MimeEntity> getParent()
        Retrieves the parent of this entity, if it is part of a multipart tree.
        Returns:
        an Optional describing the the parent MimeEntity, or an empty one if this entity has no parent

      • isMultipart

        default boolean isMultipart()
                     throws jakarta.mail.internet.ParseException
        Returns:
        true if this entity is a multipart type
        Throws:
        jakarta.mail.internet.ParseException - if the Content-Type header is present and invalid

      • getPreamble

        Optional<String> getPreamble()
        Gets the preamble of this multipart entity.
        Returns:
        an Optional describing the preamble text of the entity, an Optional empty string if there is no preamble, or an empty Optional if this is not a multipart entity

      • setPreamble

        void setPreamble(String preamble)
        Sets the preamble of this multipart entity.
        Parameters:
        preamble - the text of the preamble to set, or null to clear an existing preamble
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this is not a multipart entity

      • getBoundary

        Optional<String> getBoundary()
        Retrieves the boundary value used to separate children within this multipart entity
        Returns:
        an Optional describing the multipart boundary string, or an empty one if this is not a multipart entity

      • createChildEntity

        MimeEntity createChildEntity()
        Creates a child entity beneath this entity, with an auto-generated boundary.

        If this entity does not currently have a multipart content type, this method sets the content type to multipart/mixed and any existing content is removed.

        Returns:
        the newly-created child entity

      • createChildEntity

        MimeEntity createChildEntity(MimeEntity sibling)
        Creates a child entity beneath this entity and placed immediately before the provided entity, with an auto-generated boundary.

        If this entity does not currently have a multipart content type, this method sets the content type to multipart/mixed and any existing content is removed.

        Parameters:
        sibling - the entity in front of which to place the new child
        Returns:
        the newly-created child entity
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if sibling is not a child of the current entity

      • appendChildEntity

        void appendChildEntity(MimeEntity entity)
        Append a child entity beneath this entity, with an auto-generated boundary.

        If the provided entity already has a parent entity, it is removed from that tree.

        If this entity does not currently have a multipart content type, this method sets the content type to multipart/mixed and any existing content is removed.

        Parameters:
        entity - the entity to append

      • removeChildEntity

        void removeChildEntity(MimeEntity child)
        Removes the provided child entity from this multipart entity.
        Parameters:
        child - the child MimeEntity to remove

      • getChildren

        Optional<Iterable<MimeEntity>> getChildren()
        Returns a mutable Iterable view of the children of this multipart entity's children.

        Calling createChildEntity(MimeEntity) will invalidate any objects previously returned by this method.

        Returns:
        an Optional describing a mutable Iterable, or an empty one if this is not a multipart entity

      • getHeaders

        List<MimeHeader> getHeaders()
        Returns a list of all headers for this entity.
        Returns:
        an immutable List of MimeHeaders

      • getHeaders

        List<MimeHeader> getHeaders(String headerName)
        Returns a list of all headers for this entity that match the provided headerName.
        Parameters:
        headerName - the name of the headers to retrieve
        Returns:
        an immutable List of MimeHeaders

      • addHeader

        MimeHeader addHeader(String headerName)
        Adds a header with the provied headerName and blank content.
        Parameters:
        headerName - the name of the header to create
        Returns:
        the newly-created MimeHeader

      • addHeader

        MimeHeader addHeader(String headerName,
                     String value)
        Adds a header with the provied headerName and blank with the provided value.

        value is treated as the entire content of the header, and may contain parameters.

        Parameters:
        headerName - the name of the header to create
        value - the value of the header to set
        Returns:
        the newly-created MimeHeader

      • removeHeaders

        void removeHeaders(String headerName)
        Removes all headers of the given name from this entity.
        Parameters:
        headerName - the name of the headers to remove
